enumValues.name: ADMIN
enumValues.description: ADMIN is priviledged access for Users and Services.

enumValues.name: PARTICIPANT
enumValues.description: PARTICIPANT is access tailored for Participants' needs.

types.name: Attribute
types.description:
Attribute is a single piece of custom data set on a Node. Attributes
with the same key can be grouped into an array through the use of a unique
index field within that key's scope.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique globally identifier for the record.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time of creation of the record.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: createdBy is the Actor that created the record.

fields.name: private
fields.description:
private indicates whether the Attribute shouldn't be visible to Participants
in the scope.
private must be set on the Attribute at creation.

fields.name: protected
fields.description:
protected indicates the Attribute cannot be modified by other Participants. A
Participant can only set protected Records on their Participant record.
Users and Services can update protected Attributes.
protected must be set on the Attribute at creation.

fields.name: immutable
fields.description:
immutable indicates the Attribute can never be changed by any Actor.
immutable must be set on the Attribute at creation.

fields.name: deletedAt
fields.description:
deletedAt is the time when the Attribute was deleted. If null, the Attribute
was not deleted.

fields.name: key
fields.description: key identifies the unique key of the Attribute.

fields.name: val
fields.description:
val is the value of the Attribute. If val is not returned, it is considered to
be explicitely `null`.

fields.name: index
fields.description: index of the Attribute if the value is a vector.

fields.name: vector
fields.description: vector returns true if the value is a vector.

fields.name: version
fields.description: version is the version number of this Attribute, starting at 1.

fields.name: versions
fields.description: versions returns previous versions for the Attribute.

fields.name: current
fields.description: current is true if the Attribute is the current version of the value for key.

fields.name: node
fields.description: Object associated with Attribute.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: SetAttributeInput
types.description: SetAttributeInput sets an Attribute on a Node.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: key identifies the unique key of the Attribute.

inputFields.name: val
inputFields.description:
val is the value of the Attribute. It can be any JSON encodable value. If
value is not defined, value is assumed to be `null`.

inputFields.name: index
inputFields.description:
index of value if Attribute is a vector. An Attribute cannot mutate between
vector and non-vector formats.

inputFields.name: vector
inputFields.description: vector indicates the Attribute is a vector.

inputFields.name: append
inputFields.description: append allows appending to a vector without specifying the index.

inputFields.name: private
inputFields.description:
private indicates whether the Attribute shouldn't be visible to Participants
in the scope.
private must be set on the Attribute at creation.
Defaults to false and does need to be sent on subsequent updates.

inputFields.name: protected
inputFields.description:
protected indicates the Attribute cannot be modified by other Participants. A
Participant can only set protected Records on their Participant record.
Users and Services can update protected Attributes.
protected must be set on the Attribute at creation.
Defaults to false and does need to be sent on subsequent updates.

inputFields.name: immutable
inputFields.description:
immutable indicates the Attribute can never be changed by any Actor.
immutable must be set on the Attribute at creation.
Defaults to false and does need to be sent on subsequent updates.

inputFields.name: nodeID
inputFields.description:
ID of object on which to update the value. NodeID is required if attribute is
not created with addScope().

types.name: SetAttributePayload
types.description: SetAttributePayload is the return payload for the setAttribute mutation.

fields.name: attribute
fields.description: attribute is the Attribute updated.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: attributes returns all attributes for a scope.

fields.name: groups
fields.description: groups returns all groups

fields.name: participants
fields.description: participants returns all Participants in the system.

fields.name: scopes
fields.description:
scopes returns all scopes
If filter is provided it will return scopes matching any
ScopedAttributesInput.

fields.name: steps
fields.description: steps returns all steps

fields.name: addGroups
fields.description: addGroups creates new Groups.

fields.name: addParticipant
fields.description: addParticipant finds or creates a Participant by Unique Identifier.

fields.name: addScopes
fields.description: addScopes creates a new Scope.

fields.name: addSteps
fields.description: addSteps creates new Steps.

fields.name: link
fields.description: link links or unlinks Participants to Nodes.

fields.name: login
fields.description: login signs in a user.

fields.name: registerService
fields.description: registerService registers a new Service.

fields.name: setAttributes
fields.description: Create or update an Attribute on a Node.

fields.name: transition
fields.description: transition transition a Node from a state to another state.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: DateTime is an int64 Date + Time value given in Epoch with ns precision.

types.name: Node
types.description: Node is an interface allowing simple querying of any node

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique globally identifier for the record.

fields.name: changes
fields.description:
changes returns the changes relevant to the Participant, including changes to
the Step they are Participating in, Atrributes they have access that are
added, updated, or going in and out of scope, etc.

fields.name: globalAttributes
fields.description:
globalAttributes returns Attributes for the global Scope, which is a singleton
permission-less Scope that any client can access, even if not logged in. The
name of the global Scope is "global" and can only be updated by Users. All
Attributes in this Scope will be returned initially, then any update to
Attributes from this Scopes.

fields.name: onAnyEvent
fields.description: onAnyEvent works like onEvent, except all events are subscribed to.

fields.name: onEvent
fields.description:
onEvent attaches hooks to specified events. Optionally, a nodeType and nodeID
can be specified to only look at events for a particular record.

fields.name: scopedAttributes
fields.description:
scopedAttributes returns Attributes for Scopes matching the keys or KVs input.
keys or KVs (only one) must be provided. All Attributes in Scopes matching
will be returned initially, then any update to Attributes within the matching
Scopes.

fields.name: change
fields.description: change is the Change.

fields.name: removed
fields.description: removed indicates whether the record was removed from scope.

fields.name: done
fields.description: done indicates that the state has finished synchorizing.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the identifier for the Step.

fields.name: since
fields.description: since is the time from which the counter should count.

fields.name: state
fields.description: state is the stage the Step currently is in

fields.name: remaining
fields.description:
remaining is the duration left in seconds of the Step should last before
ending, from `since`.

fields.name: ellapsed
fields.description: ellapsed indicates the time in seconds ellapsed since the start of the Step.

fields.name: running
fields.description: running indicates whether the Step is running.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the identifier for the Scope.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: kind is the kind of the Scope.

fields.name: name
fields.description: name is the name of the Scope.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the identifier for the Attribute.

fields.name: nodeID
fields.description: nodeID is the identifier for the Attribute's Node.

fields.name: deleted
fields.description: deleted is true with the attribute was deleted.

fields.name: isNew
fields.description: isNew is true if the Attribute was just created.

fields.name: index
fields.description: index is the index of the attribute if the value is a vector.

fields.name: vector
fields.description: vector indicates whether the value is a vector.

fields.name: version
fields.description: version is the version number of this Attribute, starting at 1.

fields.name: key
fields.description: key is the attribute key being updated.

fields.name: val
fields.description: value is the value of the updated attribute.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the identifier for the Participant.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique globally identifier for the record.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time of creation of the record.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: createdBy returns the Actor that created the record.

fields.name: links
fields.description: links returns Participant linking and unlinking with this Node.

types.name: AddGroupInput
types.description: AddGroupInput creates a new Group.

inputFields.name: participantIDs
inputFields.description: participantIDs are the IDs of the Participants to link with the Group.

types.name: AddGroupPayload
types.description: AddGroupPayload is the return payload for the addGroup mutation.

fields.name: group
fields.description: group that the participant is added to.

types.name: EventType
types.description: EventType holds types of event that can trigger hooks.

enumValues.name: STEP_ADD
enumValues.description: A step was added.

enumValues.name: SCOPE_ADD
enumValues.description: A scope was added.

enumValues.name: GROUP_ADD
enumValues.description: A group was added.

enumValues.name: TRANSITION_ADD
enumValues.description: A transition was added.

enumValues.name: LINK_ADD
enumValues.description: A link was added.

enumValues.name: ATTRIBUTE_UPDATE
enumValues.description: An attribute was added or updated.

enumValues.name: PARTICIPANT_ADD
enumValues.description: A participant was added.

enumValues.name: PARTICIPANT_CONNECT
enumValues.description: A participant connected.

enumValues.name: PARTICIPANT_DISCONNECT
enumValues.description: A participant disconnected.

enumValues.name: PARTICIPANT_CONNECTED
enumValues.description:
Participant was already connected when this subscription started. This is a
special event that allows the listener to catch up on the currently connected
players at the beginning of the subscription.

types.name: OnEventInput
types.description: OnEventInput is the input for the onEvent subscription.

inputFields.name: eventTypes
inputFields.description: eventsTypes speficies which events to listen to.

inputFields.name: nodeID
inputFields.description:
nodeID is an optional node ID of the node to listen to. If nodeID is
specified, nodeType must also be given.

types.name: OnAnyEventInput
types.description: OnAnyEventInput is the input for the onAnyEvent subscription.

inputFields.name: nodeID
inputFields.description:
nodeID is an optional node ID of the node to listen to. If nodeID is
specified, nodeType must also be given.

types.name: OnEventPayload
types.description: OnEventPayload is the payload for the on[Any]Event subscriptions.

fields.name: eventID
fields.description:
eventID is a unique identifier for the current event. Each OnEventPayload for
a single client will have a different eventID. eventID will be the same for
different clients on the same event.

fields.name: eventType
fields.description: eventType is the type of the current event.

fields.name: node
fields.description: node is the node that triggered the event

types.name: Link
types.description: Link records a Participant linking or unlinking with a Node.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique globally identifier for the record.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time of creation of the record.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: createdBy is the Actor that created the record.

fields.name: link
fields.description: link indicates whether the Participant was linked or unlinked with the Node.

fields.name: participant
fields.description: participant that is assigned to

fields.name: node
fields.description: node the Participant is assigned to.

types.name: LinkInput
types.description: LinkInput links or unlinks Participants with a Node.

inputFields.name: nodeIDs
inputFields.description: nodeIDs are the IDs of the Nodes that the Participants should be added to.

inputFields.name: participantIDs
inputFields.description:
participantIDs are the IDs of the Participants that should be added to the
Nodes.

inputFields.name: link
inputFields.description:
link indicates whether the Participant was linked or unlinked with the Node.
WARNING: UNLINKING NOT CURRENTLY SUPPORTED, link must be true.

types.name: LinkPayload
types.description:
LinkPayload is the return payload for the assignParticipants
mutation.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: nodes the participants are added to.

fields.name: participants
fields.description: participants that are added to the Node.

types.name: Participant
types.description: Participant is an entity participating in Steps.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique globally identifier for the record.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time of creation of the record.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description:
identifier is the unique identifier for the Pariticipant. This is different
from the id field, which is the database internal identifier. The identifier
is how a participant "logs into" the system.

fields.name: links
fields.description:
links returns Participant linking and unlinking with Nodes. A single
Particpant might be linked and unlinked multiple times, and
so a Participant might have multiple Links on a single Node.

types.name: AddParticipantInput
types.description: AddParticipantInput finds or creates a Participant by Unique Identifier.

inputFields.name: identifier
inputFields.description:
identifier is the unique identifier for the Pariticipant. The identifier
is how a participant "logs into" the system.

types.name: AddParticipantPayload
types.description: AddParticipantPayload is the return payload for the addParticipant mutation.

fields.name: participant
fields.description: participant is the created Participants.

fields.name: sessionToken
fields.description: sessionToken is the session token to be used for authenticated requets.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique globally identifier for the record.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time of creation of the record.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: createdBy returns the Actor that created the record.

fields.name: name
fields.description: name is an optional *unique* name.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: kind is an optional type name.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: attributes returns all custom data that has been set.

args.name: deleted
args.description:
deleted will return only deleted attributes if false, by default only
non-deleted attributes are returned.

fields.name: links
fields.description:
links returns Participant linking and unlinking with this Node. A single
Particpant might be linked and unlinked multiple times, and
so a Participant might have multiple Links on a Node.

types.name: AddScopeInput
types.description: AddScopeInput creates a new Scope.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description:
name is the *unique* name of the Scope. If a scope with the same name already
exists, it will return an "already exists" error.

inputFields.name: kind
inputFields.description: kind is an optional type name.

inputFields.name: attributes
inputFields.description: attributes to be attached to the Scope at creation.

types.name: AddScopePayload
types.description: AddScopePayload is the return payload for the addScope mutation.

fields.name: scope
fields.description: scope that the participant is added to.

types.name: ScopedAttributesInput
types.description:
ScopedAttributesInput subscribes to attributes in matching scopes. Either name,
keys or kvs exclusively can be provided.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: name of the matching Scope.

inputFields.name: kind
inputFields.description: kind of the matching Scope.

inputFields.name: keys
inputFields.description: keys to Attributes in matching Scope.

inputFields.name: kvs
inputFields.description: kvs to Attributes in matching Scope.

types.name: SubAttributesPayload
types.description: SubAttributesPayload is the return payload for the scope attributes subs.

fields.name: attribute
fields.description:
scope that the participant is added to. Attribute may be null only if the
subscription did not match any Scopes and done must be published.

fields.name: done
fields.description: done indicates that the state has finished synchorizing.

fields.name: isNew
fields.description: isNew returns true if the Attribute for key and nodeID was just created.

types.name: GlobalAttributesPayload
types.description: GlobalAttributesPayload is the return payload for the addScope mutation.

fields.name: attribute
fields.description:
scope that the participant is added to. Attribute may be null only if the
subscription did not match any Scopes and done must be published.

fields.name: done
fields.description: done indicates that the state has finished synchorizing.

fields.name: isNew
fields.description: isNew returns true if the Attribute for key and nodeID was just created.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique globally identifier for the record.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time of creation of the record.

fields.name: name
fields.description: name is the name of the service gave itself.

types.name: RegisterServiceInput
types.description: RegisterServiceInput is the input for registerService()

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: name is the name of the service to register.

inputFields.name: token
inputFields.description: token is the Service Registration token.

types.name: RegisterServicePayload
types.description: RegisterServicePayload is returned by registerService()

fields.name: service
fields.description: service is newly created Service.

fields.name: sessionToken
fields.description: sessionToken is the session token to be used for authenticated requets.

types.name: State
types.description: State of Step

enumValues.name: CREATED
enumValues.description: CREATED is when the Step has been created but hasn't started yet.

enumValues.name: RUNNING
enumValues.description: RUNNING is when the Step is currently in progress.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description: PAUSED is when the Step has started but its timer was stopped.

enumValues.name: ENDED
enumValues.description: ENDED is when the Step has finished without issues.

enumValues.name: TERMINATED
enumValues.description:
TERMINATED is when the Step has been manually terminated. This could happen
before or during execution.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: ERROR is when the Step has failed (due to an unrecoverable error).

types.name: Step
types.description: Step is a span of time.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique globally identifier for the record.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time of creation of the record.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: createdBy returns the Actor that created the record.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: duration is the duration in seconds of the Step should last before ending.

fields.name: state
fields.description: state is the stage the Step currently is in

fields.name: startedAt
fields.description: startedAt is the time at which the Step started.

fields.name: endedAt
fields.description: endedAt is the time at which the Step ended.

fields.name: transitions
fields.description: transitions lists of States changes of the Step.

fields.name: links
fields.description: links returns Participant linking and unlinking with this Node.

types.name: AddStepInput
types.description: AddStepInput creates a new Step.

inputFields.name: duration
inputFields.description: duration is the duration in seconds of the Step should last before ending.

types.name: AddStepPayload
types.description: AddStepPayload is the return payload for the addStep mutation.

fields.name: step
fields.description: step that the participant is added to.

types.name: Transition
types.description: A Transition records a State change.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique globally identifier for the record.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time of creation of the record.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: createdBy is the Actor that created the record.

fields.name: from
fields.description: from is the State in which the Node was before the State change.

fields.name: to
fields.description: to is the State in which the Node was after the State change.

fields.name: node
fields.description: node is the Node that experienced this Transition.

types.name: TransitionInput
types.description: TransitionInput transitions a Node.

inputFields.name: nodeID
inputFields.description: nodeID is the ID of the Node to transition.

inputFields.name: from
to
inputFields.description: to is the desired State of the Step.

inputFields.name: cause
inputFields.description: cause is an optional open string explaining the reason for the transition.

types.name: TransitionPayload
types.description: TransitionPayload is the return payload for the transition() mutation.

fields.name: transition
fields.description: transition is the created Transition.

types.name: User
types.description: User is a user that has priviledged access to the data.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique globally identifier for the record.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time of creation of the record.

fields.name: username
fields.description: username is the login name of the user.

fields.name: name
fields.description: name is the display name of the user.

types.name: LoginInput
types.description: LoginInput is the input for login()

inputFields.name: username
inputFields.description: username is the user identifier string.

inputFields.name: password
inputFields.description: password of the user.

types.name: LoginPayload
types.description: LoginPayload is returned by login()

fields.name: user
fields.description: user is the logged in User.

fields.name: sessionToken
fields.description: sessionToken is the session token to be used for authenticated requets.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
